capsules_submitted.utterance: Vernon's lineage and maculogy are pretty interesting topics. From what I've learned, Vernon has a complex family history that involves some genetic conditions affecting his eyesight. It's been reported that he was born with a rare condition called maculogy, which affects the retina and can cause vision problems.

Vernon's lineage and maculogy are really interesting topics. I mean, have you ever heard of Vernon? He's a bit of an obscure figure in medical history, but his work on eye diseases is still studied today. Anyway, it seems that Vernon had some issues with his own eyesight, which led to the study of maculogy - essentially, the science of the macula, which is the part of the retina responsible for central vision. I'm not sure what kind of certainty there is about this information, but it's definitely a fascinating area of study.
